html: Anointed, often implies one chosen for some great work. Cyrus was to ruin the empire of Babylon, and to set the nations at liberty. He was a proof of the Deity by executing his decrees.—Cyrus. Some copies of the Septuagint seem to have readGreek: kurio, "to the Lord," incorrectly. (St. Jerome)— Though Cyrus was not anointed, he is styled thus, in allusion to the custom of the Jewish kings. (Worthington)
